title: 113_s2095
content: The Act may be cited as the "Veterans Health Care Access Received Closer to Home Act of 2014". The Congress acknowledges the importance of providing healthcare access to veterans. The sense of Congress is that veterans receiving health care in the community must maintain high quality, safety, and care coordination similar to the VA system. Lack of coordination between VA and community providers can lead to poor health outcomes and inefficient use of resources. Veteran-centric care coordination improves patient outcomes through collaboration between healthcare teams. The Secretary must ensure cost-effective care for veterans from the private sector that complements the VA health care system. SEC. 3. Reauthorization and modification of pilot program for enhanced contract care authority for veterans' health care needs. Section 403 of the Veterans' Mental Health and Other Care Improvements Act of 2008 is amended to change the timeline for a pilot program and specify locations for implementation. The Veterans' Mental Health and Other Care Improvements Act of 2008 is amended to include specific locations for a pilot program targeting rural and highly rural veterans who are enrolled in the patient enrollment system. The Veterans' Mental Health and Other Care Improvements Act of 2008 is amended to include eligibility criteria for a pilot program targeting rural veterans residing far from Department health care facilities. The Veterans' Mental Health and Other Care Improvements Act of 2008 is amended to include provisions for medical appointments to occur within 30 days of request and for outreach to inform eligible veterans of the pilot program.
